definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Have you notice the Sashimi in wonderful colors?
sentences.chinese: 有看到那些色彩鲜艳的刺身吗？

sentences.english: The fresh materials are transported by air everyday.
sentences.chinese: 新鲜的刺身料理，均为每日空运来店。

sentences.english: He is deathly afraid of needles, so he doesn't have any piercings or tattoos.
sentences.chinese: 他怕针头怕得要死，所以他没有大国东也没有刺身。

sentences.english: So he goes down with the ship sashimi-style.
sentences.chinese: 因此他和他的船就以生鱼片刺身的形式往下去了。

sentences.english: I do love some halibut sashimi with truffle, I like me some blue crab hand roll.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢大比目鱼刺身配上松露，我也喜欢蓝蟹手卷。

sentences.english: And it’s all just another reason to keep those cell phones and temporary tats away from young hands.
sentences.chinese: 还有另外一个理由是让手机和临时刺身远离幼手。

sentences.english: A Sashimi platter was served, and it was perfection.
sentences.chinese: 一盘刺身被端了上来，它简直就是完美。

definition: Japanese cuisine (abbr. for 日本料理[Ri4 ben3 liao4 li3])
tempura/deep-fried cooking/also called 甜不辣[tian2 bu4 la4]
